title: Kristen Bell gives a sneak peek of her new Frozen 2 song The Next Right Thing as
text:
Kristen Bell is whipping up fans into a Frozen frenzy.

The 39-year-old, who voices Princess Anna in the Frozen films, released a sneak peek of her new song from Frozen 2 on Wednesday.

Bell shared the short clip of the tune titled The Next Right Thing on social media as excitement mounts for the release of the animated sequel.

Brr! Kristen Bell released a sneak peek of her new song The Next Right Thing from Frozen 2 on Wednesday

'A sneak peak of my new song in Frozen 2, "The Next Right Thing"...,' the star simply captioned the clip on Instagram.

Princess Anna is seen as she climbs over a rocky terrain, scaling rocks and leaping from cliff to cliff until she finally emerges from the dark through a cave.

Bell's voice rings out: 'Just do the next right thing, take a step, step again, it is all that I can, to do the next right thing.'

Much of the scene is obscured by the words 'Disney Frozen II The Next Right Thing' which are scrawled across the screen in the icy blue Frozen font.

'A sneak peak of my new song in Frozen 2, "The Next Right Thing"...,' the star simply captioned the clip on Instagram

Kristen shared the song snippet just about a month before the full soundtrack for the sequel is released.

Earleri this week, Disney teased more about what is in store for Frozen 2 as they dropped the third trailer on Monday.

Set three years after the events of 2013's Frozen, Elsa (Idina Menzel) and sister Anna (Kirsten Bell) go on a journey to explore if she was born with her magical powers.

Together with Kristoff (Jonathan Groff), Olaf (Josh Gad) and Sven, the group sets out on a dangerous but remarkable expedition as their kingdom Arendelle faces terrible danger.

Bell's voice rings out: 'Just do the next right thing, take a step, step again, it is all that I can, to do the next right thing.'

Listen up! The original Frozen featured Idina Menzel's hit Let It Go which reached the top 10 on the Billboard charts

The trailer starts with a 'distracted and worried' Elsa hearing a voice which is calling her, before the people of Arendelle are forced to flee the kingdom and take refuge in the cliffs.

Troll King Grand Pabbie informs the royals: 'The kingdom is not safe. Find who is calling to you, they may have answers.'

The trailer features several action sequences with Elsa conjuring large sheets of ice from her hands and riding on a horse while the soldiers say they must 'protect Arendelle at all costs'.

Sisters! Disney unveiled the third official trailer for Frozen 2 earlier this week

Let it go! Set three years after the events of 2013's Frozen, Elsa (Idina Menzel) and sister Anna (Kirsten Bell) go on a journey together with Kristoff (Jonathan Groff), Olaf (Josh Gad) and Sven as their kingdom Arendelle faces terrible danger

Follow up: The original film followed Anna trying to be reunited with Elsa after her powers inadvertently trapped Arendelle in an eternal winter

There is also the threat of a large, stone-like monster who storms through the forest chasing Anna.

The original film followed Anna trying to be reunited with Elsa after her powers inadvertently trapped Arendelle in an eternal winter.

The film won two Academy Awards, one for Best Animated Feature and Best Original Song for Let It Go, and grossed $1.27 billion at the box office.

Disney will release the full soundtrack for the film on November 15 and then the full feature is set to be released in UK and US cinemas on Friday, November 22.
